meanings.def: to produce letters, pictures, etc. on paper using a machine that puts ink (= coloured liquid) on the surface
examples: print (something) I'm printing a copy of the document for you.
Do you want your address printed at the top of the letter?
(computing) Click on the icon when you want to print.
be printed with something Each card is printed with a different message.
I couldn't get the graphics to print correctly.
The images are scanned onto computers and digitally printed.
The message was printed in blue ink.
printing from a file

meanings.def: to produce books, newspapers, etc. by printing them in large quantities
examples: They printed 30 000 copies of the book.
The firm specializes in printing calendars.
She had the memoir privately printed in a limited edition.
The book is beautifully printed on good quality paper.
We had the first issue of the newsletter professionally printed.
a leaflet printed on recycled paper
He was handing out cheaply printed business cards.

meanings.def: to publish something in printed form
examples: The photo was printed in all the national newspapers.
The magazine was sued for printing a libellous article about her family.

meanings.def: to produce a photograph on paper from a digital file or from film
examples: Photographs can be printed from a digital file or from a negative.

meanings.def: to write without joining the letters together
examples: Print your name and address clearly in the space provided.
He had printed his name in capitals at the bottom of the picture.
In some countries children learn to print when they first go to school.

meanings.def: to make a mark on a soft surface by pressing
examples: The tracks of the large animal were clearly printed in the sand.
(figurative) The memory of that day was indelibly printed on his brain.

meanings.def: to make a design on a surface or cloth by pressing a surface against it which has been coloured with ink or dye
examples: print A on B They had printed their own design on the T-shirt.
print B with A a T-shirt printed with their own design

meanings.def: used to describe a business that makes a lot of money with little effort
having no value, especially legally, or because one of the people involved has no intention of doing what they said they would
what is published in books, newspapers, etc.
examples: the power of the printed word

idioms.def: used to describe a business that makes a lot of money with little effort

idioms.idiom: not worth the paper it’s written/printed on
idioms.def: having no value, especially legally, or because one of the people involved has no intention of doing what they said they would
what is published in books, newspapers, etc.
examples: the power of the printed word

meanings.def: letters, words, numbers, etc. that have been printed onto paper
examples: The tiny print was hard to read without my glasses.
in… print in large/bold print
The terms of delivery appear at the bottom of the invoice in small print.
The print quality of the new laser printer is superb.
the print edition/version of the dictionary
television and print ads
I had to squint to read the tiny print on the screen.
They make more money from online subscriptions than from selling the print version.

meanings.def: used to refer to the business of producing newspapers, magazines and books
examples: the print media
print unions

meanings.def: a mark left by your finger, foot, etc. on the surface of something
examples: His prints were found on the gun.
There were paw prints everywhere.

meanings.def: a picture that is cut into wood or metal then covered with ink (= coloured liquid for printing, drawing, etc.) and printed onto paper; a picture that is copied from a painting using photography
examples: a framed set of prints
a Renoir print
The children were drawing pictures of their pets.
a collection of paintings by American artists
a pencil/​charcoal drawing
Vermeer’s ‘Portrait of the artist in his studio’
a self-portrait (= a painting that you do of yourself)
a Renoir print
I usually do a few very rough sketches before I start on a painting.

meanings.def: a photograph produced from film
examples: How many sets of prints would you like?
a colour print
a photograph of the house
Can I take a photograph?
We had our picture taken in front of the hotel.
a passport photo
I tried to get a shot of him in the water.
holiday snaps
a set of prints

meanings.def: cotton cloth that has a pattern printed on it; this pattern
examples: a cotton print dress
a floral print

meanings.def: to be published
examples: By the time this gets into print, they'll already have left the country.

meanings.def: still available from the company that publishes it
examples: Is this edition still in print?

meanings.def: printed in a book, newspaper, etc.
examples: It was the first time he had seen his name in print.

meanings.def: no longer available from the company that publishes it
examples: Her first novel is now out of print.
The shop specializes in out-of-print books.
By the time this gets into print, they'll already have left the country.

idioms.def: still available from the company that publishes it
examples: Is this edition still in print?
It was the first time he had seen his name in print.

idioms.def: no longer available from the company that publishes it
examples: Her first novel is now out of print.
The shop specializes in out-of-print books.
